findings.title: Contract Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract contains inconsistencies and unclear business logic due to poor naming conventions and unclean code.

findings.title: ST - Stop Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop transactions for all users excluding the owner, which can be exploited in various ways.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceed Limit Fees Manipulation
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by setting the fees a high percentage value.

findings.title: BC - Blacklisted Contracts
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop contracts from transactions by calling the `F01_Blacklist_Malicious_Account` function, which can be abused.

findings.title: L01 - Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: Constant state variables should be declared constant to save gas.

findings.title: L03 - Redundant Statements
findings.description: Detect the usage of redundant statements that have no effect.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Solidity defines a naming convention that should be followed.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code elimination is required to remove unnecessary code.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.
